answers.author: Terrell Jacobs
answers.text:
We have some of the information in our charter, code of ethics and in resolutions passed as issues have developed. I think that we should compile the information and make one document such as Bainbridge Island has done.  We have done something similar for our zoning, development codes, subdivision regulations, and other documents related to land development into our "Uniform Land Development Codes."

I found the problem to be that any document iso nly as good as its enforcement.

author: Henry Hill
text: The Frisco, Texas City Council is working on a policy and protocol manual to detail agreed upon practices and principles.  Frisco has put in place a modified Carver Governance Model.  The goal is to improve Governance document understandings for current use and for future Council Members.  we have only found a few communities who have adopted such and there is very little that has come to light through research about the experiences of communities with Policy Manuals.  I would appreciate hearing any examples or observations.
title: Council Policy Manual
